intro: Turnera aurelioi, commonly known as the golden turnera, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its botanical name honors the Spanish botanist José Antonio de Turner. Turnera aurelioi is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and vibrant floral display.
